This error occurs in a Next.js application when you're trying to use Server Actions incorrectly. The specific error message indicates that a file marked with "use server" is exporting something other than async functions.

Here's what's happening and how to fix it:

The Problem:

  1. You have a file (likely src/app/lib/db.ts) that's being used in your /api/auth/send-otp route.

  2. This file is either marked with "use server" or is being treated as a Server Action file.

  3. The file is exporting an object or non-async function, which violates the Server Actions rules.

Solutions:

  1. Check your db.ts file:

    • If you've added "use server" to this file, either:

      • Convert all exports to async functions

      • Remove "use server" if it's not meant to be a Server Actions file

  2. If you're using Server Actions:

    • Ensure all exported functions are async

    • Example of correct usage:

      typescript
      Copy
      Download
      "use server";

export async function sendOTP(email: string) {
  // Your OTP sending logic
}

  3. For your API route (/api/auth/send-otp/route.ts):

    • Make sure you're properly handling the request:

      typescript
      Copy
      Download
      import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';

export async function POST(request: Request) {
  try {
    // Your OTP sending logic
    return NextResponse.json({ success: true });
  } catch (error) {
    return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to send OTP' }, { status: 500 });
  }
}

  4. Check your imports:

    • Ensure you're not accidentally importing a non-async object from db.ts into your Server Action or API route.

Additional Tips:

  • The error trace shows the problem originates in db.ts at line 36 - check that line specifically

  • Make sure you're not mixing Server Actions patterns with regular API routes

  • If db.ts is meant to be a database client, it probably shouldn't be a Server Actions file

Without seeing your actual code, these are the most likely solutions based on the error message. The key is that any file with "use server" can only export async functions - no objects, no synchronous functions, no other types of exports.

Solution 1: Proper Database Connection Setup (Recommended)

// src/app/lib/db.ts
import { Pool } from 'mysql2/promise';

// Create the connection pool
const pool = new Pool({
  host: process.env.DB_HOST,
  user: process.env.DB_USER,
  password: process.env.DB_PASSWORD,
  database: process.env.DB_NAME,
  waitForConnections: true,
  connectionLimit: 10,
  queueLimit: 0
});

// Export just the pool (no "use server" directive)
export { pool };

  1. Make sure you're not accidentally adding "use server" in this file.

Solution 2: If you actually need Server Actions

If you specifically need to use Server Actions with your database calls:

Download
// src/app/lib/db.ts
"use server";

import { Pool } from 'mysql2/promise';

const getPool = async () => {
  return new Pool({
    host: process.env.DB_HOST,
    user: process.env.DB_USER,
    password: process.env.DB_PASSWORD,
    database: process.env.DB_NAME,
    waitForConnections: true,
    connectionLimit: 10,
    queueLimit: 0
  });
};

export async function query(sql: string, params?: any[]) {
  const pool = await getPool();
  try {
    const [rows] = await pool.query(sql, params);
    return rows;
  } finally {
    await pool.end();
  }
}

The issue you're describing suggests that while your OTP verification endpoint returns a 200 status code and sets the auth cookie, the authentication state isn't being maintained when navigating to other pages. Here's how to fix this:

Common Issues and Solutions:

  1. Cookie Settings:

    • Make sure your cookie settings are correct for cross-page authentication

    • Add sameSite: "lax" (or "strict") to your cookie settings

typescript
Copy
Download
response.cookies.set("auth_token", token, {
  httpOnly: true,
  secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === "production", // true in production
  sameSite: "lax", // or "strict"
  path: "/",
  maxAge: 60 * 60 * 24, // 1 day
});

  1. Middleware Configuration:

    • Ensure you have proper middleware to check the auth token on protected routes

    • Create a middleware.ts file in your root or /src folder:

typescript
Copy
Download
// middleware.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server';
import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';

export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const token = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;
  const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;

  // Protected routes
  const protectedRoutes = ['/dashboard', '/profile']; // Add your protected routes

  if (protectedRoutes.some(route => pathname.startsWith(route))) {
    try {
      jwt.verify(token, process.env.JWT_SECRET!);
    } catch (err) {
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
    }
  }

  return NextResponse.next();
}

  1. Client-Side Authentication State:

    • You need to sync the auth state between server and client

    • Create an endpoint to check auth status:

typescript
Copy
Download
// app/api/auth/check/route.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';

export async function GET(request: Request) {
  const token = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;

  if (!token) {
    return NextResponse.json({ authenticated: false });
  }

  try {
    const decoded = jwt.verify(token, process.env.JWT_SECRET!);
    return NextResponse.json({ authenticated: true, user: decoded });
  } catch (err) {
    return NextResponse.json({ authenticated: false });
  }
}

  1. Client-Side Auth Context:

    • Create an auth context/provider to manage state:

typescript
Copy
Download
// context/AuthContext.tsx
'use client';
import { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from 'react';

interface AuthContextType {
  isAuthenticated: boolean;
  user: any;
  loading: boolean;
}

const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType>({
  isAuthenticated: false,
  user: null,
  loading: true,
});

export function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  const [authState, setAuthState] = useState({
    isAuthenticated: false,
    user: null,
    loading: true,
  });

  useEffect(() => {
    const checkAuth = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch('/api/auth/check');
        const data = await res.json();
        setAuthState({
          isAuthenticated: data.authenticated,
          user: data.user || null,
          loading: false,
        });
      } catch (err) {
        setAuthState({
          isAuthenticated: false,
          user: null,
          loading: false,
        });
      }
    };

    checkAuth();
  }, []);

  return (
    <AuthContext.Provider value={authState}>
      {children}
    </AuthContext.Provider>
  );
}

export const useAuth = () => useContext(AuthContext);

  1. Wrap Your App:

    • Add the AuthProvider to your root layout:

typescript
Copy
Download
// app/layout.tsx
import { AuthProvider } from '@/context/AuthContext';

export default function RootLayout({
  children,
}: {
  children: React.ReactNode
}) {
  return (
    <html lang="en">
      <body>
        <AuthProvider>
          {children}
        </AuthProvider>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}

  1. Protected Page Example:

    • How to use in a protected page:

typescript
Copy
Download
// app/dashboard/page.tsx
'use client';
import { useAuth } from '@/context/AuthContext';
import { useEffect } from 'react';
import { useRouter } from 'next/navigation';

export default function Dashboard() {
  const { isAuthenticated, loading } = useAuth();
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!loading && !isAuthenticated) {
      router.push('/login');
    }
  }, [isAuthenticated, loading, router]);

  if (loading || !isAuthenticated) {
    return <div>Loading...</div>;
  }

  return <div>Dashboard Content</div>;
}

Debugging Steps:

  1. Check Cookie in DevTools:

    • Open Chrome DevTools → Application → Cookies

    • Verify the auth_token cookie is present with correct expiration

  2. Test API Endpoints:

    • Manually test /api/auth/check to verify it returns the expected response

  3. Verify JWT Secret:

    • Ensure process.env.JWT_SECRET is consistent across all files

  4. Check Redirects:

    • Look for any middleware or component logic that might force redirects

  5. Network Tab:

    • Check if subsequent requests include the cookie in the headers

( <div> <h1>Enter Admin-Approved Email</h1> <input type="email" value={email} onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)} /> <button onClick={handleSendOtp}>Send OTP</button> </div> ) : ( <div> <h1>Enter OTP sent to {email}</h1> <input type="text" value={otp} onChange={(e) => setOtp(e.target.value)} /> <button onClick={handleVerifyOtp}>Verify OTP</button> </div> )} {error && <p style={{ color: "red" }}>{error}</p>} </div> ); } estilize mais amigavelmente

Here's a more styled and user-friendly version of your login component with a clean, modern design:

tsx
Copy
Download
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";

export default function Login() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [otp, setOtp] = useState("");
  const [step, setStep] = useState<"email" | "otp">("email");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);

  const handleSendOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/send-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        setStep("otp");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Failed to send OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Network error. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  const handleVerifyOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/verify-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, otp }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        window.location.href = "/";
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Invalid OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Network error. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-50 flex flex-col justify-center py-12 sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
      <div className="sm:mx-auto sm:w-full sm:max-w-md">
        <h2 className="mt-6 text-center text-3xl font-extrabold text-gray-900">
          {step === "email" ? "Enter your email" : "Verify your OTP"}
        </h2>
      </div>

      <div className="mt-8 sm:mx-auto sm:w-full sm:max-w-md">
        <div className="bg-white py-8 px-4 shadow sm:rounded-lg sm:px-10">
          {error && (
            <div className="mb-4 bg-red-50 border-l-4 border-red-500 p-4">
              <div className="flex">
                <div className="flex-shrink-0">
                  <svg
                    className="h-5 w-5 text-red-500"
                    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                    viewBox="0 0 20 20"
                    fill="currentColor"
                  >
                    <path
                      fillRule="evenodd"
                      d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zM8.707 7.293a1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414L8.586 10l-1.293 1.293a1 1 0 101.414 1.414L10 11.414l1.293 1.293a1 1 0 001.414-1.414L11.414 10l1.293-1.293a1 1 0 00-1.414-1.414L10 8.586 8.707 7.293z"
                      clipRule="evenodd"
                    />
                  </svg>
                </div>
                <div className="ml-3">
                  <p className="text-sm text-red-700">{error}</p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          )}

          {step === "email" ? (
            <div className="space-y-6">
              <div>
                <label
                  htmlFor="email"
                  className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700"
                >
                  Admin-approved email
                </label>
                <div className="mt-1">
                  <input
                    id="email"
                    name="email"
                    type="email"
                    autoComplete="email"
                    required
                    value={email}
                    onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
                    className="appearance-none block w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm placeholder-gray-400 focus:outline-none focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500 sm:text-sm"
                  />
                </div>
              </div>

              <div>
                <button
                  onClick={handleSendOtp}
                  disabled={loading || !email}
                  className={`w-full flex justify-center py-2 px-4 border border-transparent rounded-md shadow-sm text-sm font-medium text-white bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-offset-2 focus:ring-blue-500 ${
                    loading || !email ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                  }`}
                >
                  {loading ? (
                    <>
                      <svg
                        className="animate-spin -ml-1 mr-3 h-5 w-5 text-white"
                        xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                        fill="none"
                        viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                      >
                        <circle
                          className="opacity-25"
                          cx="12"
                          cy="12"
                          r="10"
                          stroke="currentColor"
                          strokeWidth="4"
                        ></circle>
                        <path
                          className="opacity-75"
                          fill="currentColor"
                          d="M4 12a8 8 0 018-8V0C5.373 0 0 5.373 0 12h4zm2 5.291A7.962 7.962 0 014 12H0c0 3.042 1.135 5.824 3 7.938l3-2.647z"
                        ></path>
                      </svg>
                      Sending...
                    </>
                  ) : (
                    "Send OTP"
                  )}
                </button>
              </div>
            </div>
          ) : (
            <div className="space-y-6">
              <div>
                <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-4">
                  We sent a 6-digit code to <span className="font-medium">{email}</span>
                </p>
                <label
                  htmlFor="otp"
                  className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700"
                >
                  OTP Code
                </label>
                <div className="mt-1">
                  <input
                    id="otp"
                    name="otp"
                    type="text"
                    inputMode="numeric"
                    pattern="[0-9]*"
                    maxLength={6}
                    required
                    value={otp}
                    onChange={(e) => setOtp(e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '').slice(0, 6))}
                    className="appearance-none block w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm placeholder-gray-400 focus:outline-none focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500 sm:text-sm"
                  />
                </div>
              </div>

              <div className="flex items-center justify-between">
                <button
                  onClick={() => setStep("email")}
                  className="text-sm font-medium text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-500"
                >
                  Use different email
                </button>
                <button
                  onClick={handleSendOtp}
                  className="text-sm font-medium text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-500"
                >
                  Resend OTP
                </button>
              </div>

              <div>
                <button
                  onClick={handleVerifyOtp}
                  disabled={loading || otp.length !== 6}
                  className={`w-full flex justify-center py-2 px-4 border border-transparent rounded-md shadow-sm text-sm font-medium text-white bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-offset-2 focus:ring-blue-500 ${
                    loading || otp.length !== 6 ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                  }`}
                >
                  {loading ? (
                    <>
                      <svg
                        className="animate-spin -ml-1 mr-3 h-5 w-5 text-white"
                        xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
                        fill="none"
                        viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                      >
                        <circle
                          className="opacity-25"
                          cx="12"
                          cy="12"
                          r="10"
                          stroke="currentColor"
                          strokeWidth="4"
                        ></circle>
                        <path
                          className="opacity-75"
                          fill="currentColor"
                          d="M4 12a8 8 0 018-8V0C5.373 0 0 5.373 0 12h4zm2 5.291A7.962 7.962 0 014 12H0c0 3.042 1.135 5.824 3 7.938l3-2.647z"
                        ></path>
                      </svg>
                      Verifying...
                    </>
                  ) : (
                    "Verify OTP"
                  )}
                </button>
              </div>
            </div>
          )}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Key Improvements:

  1. Modern UI Design:

    • Clean white card layout with subtle shadows

    • Proper spacing and typography

    • Responsive design that works on all screen sizes

  2. Enhanced User Experience:

    • Loading states with spinners

    • Disabled buttons when actions can't be performed

    • Error display with proper icon and styling

    • OTP input validation (only numbers, max 6 digits)

  3. Additional Features:

    • Clear error states

To use this component, make sure you have Tailwind CSS configured in your project. If you're not using Tailwind, you can convert these classes to regular CSS or use another styling solution.

The component maintains all your original functionality while providing a much more polished user experience.

how to log out

Here's how to implement a logout function in your Next.js application, building on your existing authentication system:

1. Create a Logout API Route

tsx
Copy
Download
// app/api/auth/logout/route.ts
import { NextResponse } from "next/server";

export async function POST() {
  const response = NextResponse.json({ success: true });
  
  // Clear the auth token cookie
  response.cookies.set("auth_token", "", {
    httpOnly: true,
    secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === "production",
    sameSite: "lax",
    path: "/",
    expires: new Date(0), // Set to past date to expire immediately
  });

  return response;
}

2. Create a Logout Button Component

tsx
Copy
Download
// components/LogoutButton.tsx
"use client";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function LogoutButton() {
  const router = useRouter();

  const handleLogout = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch("/api/auth/logout", {
        method: "POST",
      });

      if (response.ok) {
        router.push("/login");
        router.refresh(); // Ensure client-side cache is cleared
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Logout failed:", error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <button
      onClick={handleLogout}
      className="px-4 py-2 bg-red-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-red-700 transition-colors"
    >
      Logout
    </button>
  );
}

3. Update Your Auth Context (if using)

If you're using the AuthContext from earlier, add a logout function:

tsx
Copy
Download
// context/AuthContext.tsx
const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType>({
  isAuthenticated: false,
  user: null,
  loading: true,
  logout: async () => {}, // Add this
});

export function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  // ... existing state
  
  const logout = async () => {
    try {
      await fetch('/api/auth/logout', { method: 'POST' });
      setAuthState({
        isAuthenticated: false,
        user: null,
        loading: false,
      });
      window.location.href = '/login'; // Full refresh to clear state
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Logout failed:', err);
    }
  };

  return (
    <AuthContext.Provider value={{ ...authState, logout }}>
      {children}
    </AuthContext.Provider>
  );
}

4. Usage in Your App

Now you can use the logout functionality in your components:

tsx
Copy
Download
// Example in Navbar.tsx
"use client";
import { useAuth } from "@/context/AuthContext";
import LogoutButton from "@/components/LogoutButton";

export default function Navbar() {
  const { isAuthenticated } = useAuth();

  return (
    <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4">
      <div className="container mx-auto flex justify-between items-center">
        <div className="text-white font-bold">My App</div>
        {isAuthenticated && <LogoutButton />}
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
}

5. Update Middleware (Optional)

If you're using middleware, you might want to redirect to login after logout:

tsx
Copy
Download
// middleware.ts
export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const token = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;
  const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;

  // Add logout path handling
  if (pathname === '/logout') {
    const response = NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
    response.cookies.delete('auth_token');
    return response;
  }

  // ... rest of your middleware
}

Key Security Considerations:

  1. HttpOnly Cookies: Your auth token cookie should remain HttpOnly for security

  2. SameSite Attribute: Prevents CSRF attacks

  3. Secure Flag: Essential in production for HTTPS

  4. Client-Side State: Ensure all auth state is cleared on logout

  5. Server-Side Validation: Always verify the auth token on protected routes

Testing the Logout Flow:

  1. Click logout button

  2. Verify:

    • Auth token cookie is removed

    • Redirects to login page

    • Cannot access protected routes

    • Refreshing the page maintains logged out state

This implementation provides a complete logout solution that works with your existing OTP-based authentication system.

tela de login sem rootlayout

Se você quer criar uma tela de login independente, sem usar o RootLayout padrão do Next.js (que pode ter estilos ou componentes que você não quer na página de login), aqui está como implementar:

1. Crie um layout específico para login

tsx
Copy
Download
// app/login/layout.tsx
import type { Metadata } from 'next'

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: 'Login',
}

export default function LoginLayout({
  children,
}: {
  children: React.ReactNode
}) {
  return (
    <html lang="pt-BR">
      <body className="bg-gray-50">
        {children}
      </body>
    </html>
  )
}

2. Crie a página de login

tsx
Copy
Download
// app/login/page.tsx
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function LoginPage() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [otp, setOtp] = useState("");
  const [step, setStep] = useState<"email" | "otp">("email");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const router = useRouter();

  const handleSendOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/send-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        setStep("otp");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Falha ao enviar OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Erro de rede. Tente novamente.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  const handleVerifyOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/verify-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, otp }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        router.push("/dashboard"); // Redireciona para a página principal após login
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "OTP inválido");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Erro de rede. Tente novamente.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md">
        <div className="bg-white p-8 rounded-lg shadow-md">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center mb-6 text-gray-800">
            {step === "email" ? "Login" : "Verificação OTP"}
          </h1>

          {error && (
            <div className="mb-4 p-3 bg-red-100 border border-red-400 text-red-700 rounded">
              {error}
            </div>
          )}

          {step === "email" ? (
            <div className="space-y-4">
              <div>
                <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                  Email
                </label>
                <input
                  type="email"
                  value={email}
                  onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
                  className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
                  placeholder="seu@email.com"
                />
              </div>

              <button
                onClick={handleSendOtp}
                disabled={loading || !email}
                className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2 ${
                  loading || !email ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                }`}
              >
                {loading ? "Enviando..." : "Enviar OTP"}
              </button>
            </div>
          ) : (
            <div className="space-y-4">
              <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-2">
                Enviamos um código de 6 dígitos para <span className="font-semibold">{email}</span>
              </p>
              
              <div>
                <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                  Código OTP
                </label>
                <input
                  type="text"
                  value={otp}
                  onChange={(e) => setOtp(e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '').slice(0, 6))}
                  className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
                  placeholder="123456"
                  maxLength={6}
                />
              </div>

              <div className="flex justify-between text-sm">
                <button
                  onClick={() => setStep("email")}
                  className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800"
                >
                  Alterar email
                </button>
                <button
                  onClick={handleSendOtp}
                  className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800"
                >
                  Reenviar OTP
                </button>
              </div>

              <button
                onClick={handleVerifyOtp}
                disabled={loading || otp.length !== 6}
                className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2 ${
                  loading || otp.length !== 6 ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                }`}
              >
                {loading ? "Verificando..." : "Verificar OTP"}
              </button>
            </div>
          )}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

3. Configuração importante

  1. Desative o layout padrão:

    • O arquivo app/login/layout.tsx substitui o RootLayout padrão apenas para a rota /login

  2. Redirecionamento após login:

    • Após verificação bem-sucedida do OTP, o usuário é redirecionado para /dashboard (ou outra rota protegida)

  3. Estilos independentes:

    • Esta página não herda nenhum estilo ou componente do layout principal

  4. Rotas protegidas:

    • Certifique-se de que suas rotas protegidas verifiquem a autenticação (usando middleware ou getServerSideProps)

4. Middleware para proteção de rotas (opcional)

tsx
Copy
Download
// middleware.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server'

export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const token = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value
  const { pathname } = request.nextUrl

  // Se tentar acessar login já autenticado, redireciona
  if (pathname === '/login' && token) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url))
  }

  // Protege rotas que não são login
  if (!pathname.startsWith('/login') && !token) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url))
  }

  return NextResponse.next()
}

Benefícios desta abordagem:

  1. Isolamento completo: A página de login não compartilha estilos ou componentes com o restante do app

  2. Segurança: Implementação limpa do fluxo de autenticação

  3. Experiência do usuário: Design focado apenas na tarefa de login

  4. Facilidade de manutenção: Toda a lógica de login em um só lugar

Esta implementação cria uma tela de login autônoma que não depende do layout principal da aplicação, com um fluxo completo de autenticação por OTP.

Resolving Hydration Error in Next.js Login Page

The hydration error occurs when the server-rendered HTML doesn't match what React expects to render on the client. Here's how to fix it for your login page:

Main Causes and Solutions

  1. Client-Side Only Components:

    • Your login page uses client-side state (useState, useRouter) but isn't properly marked as a client component

  2. Mismatched HTML Structure:

    • The server and client render slightly different HTML structures

  3. Browser APIs in Server Components:

    • Direct usage of window or browser APIs that aren't available during SSR

Fixed Implementation

tsx
Copy
Download
// app/login/page.tsx
'use client'; // This must be the very first line

import { useState } from "react";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function LoginPage() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [otp, setOtp] = useState("");
  const [step, setStep] = useState<"email" | "otp">("email");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const router = useRouter();

  const handleSendOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/send-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        setStep("otp");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Failed to send OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Network error. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  const handleVerifyOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/verify-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, otp }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        router.push("/dashboard");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Invalid OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Network error. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md">
        <div className="bg-white p-8 rounded-lg shadow-md">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center mb-6 text-gray-800">
            {step === "email" ? "Login" : "Verify OTP"}
          </h1>

          {error && (

              {error}
            </div>
          )}

          {step === "email" ? (
            <div className="space-y-4">
              <div>
                <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                  Email
                </label>
                <input
                  type="email"
                  value={email}
                  onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
                  className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
                  placeholder="your@email.com"
                />
              </div>

              <button
                onClick={handleSendOtp}
                disabled={loading || !email}
                className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2 ${
                  loading || !email ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                }`}
              >
                {loading ? "Sending..." : "Send OTP"}
              </button>
            </div>
          ) : (
            <div className="space-y-4">
              <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-2">
                We sent a 6-digit code to <span className="font-semibold">{email}</span>
              </p>
              
              <div>
                <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                  OTP Code
                </label>
                <input
                  type="text"
                  value={otp}
                  onChange={(e) => setOtp(e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '').slice(0, 6))}
                  className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
                  placeholder="123456"
                  maxLength={6}
                />
              </div>

              <div className="flex justify-between text-sm">
                <button
                  onClick={() => setStep("email")}
                  className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800"
                >
                  Change email
                </button>
                <button
                  onClick={handleSendOtp}
                  className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800"
                >
                  Resend OTP
                </button>
              </div>

              <button
                onClick={handleVerifyOtp}
                disabled={loading || otp.length !== 6}
                className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2 ${
                  loading || otp.length !== 6 ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                }`}
              >
                {loading ? "Verifying..." : "Verify OTP"}

    </div>
  );
}

Key Fixes:

  1. Added 'use client' directive: This must be the very first line in the file to properly mark it as a Client Component

  2. Simplified component structure: Ensured the HTML structure is consistent between server and client

  3. Removed direct browser API usage: Replaced window.location.href with Next.js router.push()

  4. Consistent state management: All state-related code is properly contained within the client component

Additional Recommendations:

  1. Update Next.js: As the error suggests, you should update Next.js to the latest version:

Comprehensive Solution for Next.js Hydration Error

The hydration error you're experiencing occurs when there's a mismatch between server-rendered HTML and client-side React rendering. Let's fix this systematically.

Root Cause Analysis

The error suggests:

  1. Your Next.js version (14.2.29) is outdated

  2. There's a mismatch in the <div> structure between server and client renders

  3. The issue originates in your LoginPage component

Complete Solution

2. Fix the Login Page Structure

tsx
Copy

// app/login/page.tsx
'use client'; // Must be first line

import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function LoginPage() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [otp, setOtp] = useState("");
  const [step, setStep] = useState<"email" | "otp">("email");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [isMounted, setIsMounted] = useState(false);
  const router = useRouter();

  // Ensure component is mounted to avoid hydration mismatch
  useEffect(() => {
    setIsMounted(true);
  }, []);

  const handleSendOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/send-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        setStep("otp");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Failed to send OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Network error. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  const handleVerifyOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/verify-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, otp }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        router.push("/dashboard");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Invalid OTP");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Network error. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  if (!isMounted) {
    // Return null or a loader during SSR
    return null;
  }

  return (
    <main className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md">
        <div className="bg-white p-8 rounded-lg shadow-md">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center mb-6 text-gray-800">
            {step === "email" ? "Login" : "Verify OTP"}
          </h1>

          {error && (
            <div className="mb-4 p-3 bg-red-100 border border-red-400 text-red-700 rounded">
              {error}
            </div>
          )}

          {step === "email" ? (
            <form onSubmit={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); handleSendOtp(); }}>
              <div className="space-y-4">
                <div>
                  <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                    Email
                  </label>
                  <input
                    type="email"
                    value={email}
                    onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
                    className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
                    placeholder="your@email.com"
                    required
                  />
                </div>

                <button
                  type="submit"
                  disabled={loading || !email}
                  className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2 ${
                    loading || !email ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                  }`}
                >
                  {loading ? "Sending..." : "Send OTP"}
                </button>
              </div>
            </form>
          ) : (
            <form onSubmit={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); handleVerifyOtp(); }}>
              <div className="space-y-4">
                <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-2">
                  We sent a 6-digit code to <span className="font-semibold">{email}</span>
                </p>
                
                <div>
                  <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                    OTP Code
                  </label>
                  <input
                    type="text"
                    inputMode="numeric"
                    pattern="[0-9]*"
                    value={otp}
                    onChange={(e) => setOtp(e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '').slice(0, 6))}
                    className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
                    placeholder="123456"
                    maxLength={6}
                    required
                  />
                </div>

                <div className="flex justify-between text-sm">
                  <button
                    type="button"
                    onClick={() => setStep("email")}
                    className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800"
                  >
                    Change email
                  </button>
                  <button
                    type="button"
                    onClick={handleSendOtp}
                    className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800"
                  >
                    Resend OTP
                  </button>
                </div>

                <button
                  type="submit"
                  disabled={loading || otp.length !== 6}
                  className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2 ${
                    loading || otp.length !== 6 ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                  }`}
                >
                  {loading ? "Verifying..." : "Verify OTP"}
                </button>
              </div>
            </form>
          )}
        </div>
      </div>
    </main>
  );
}

Here's how to modify your RootLayout to conditionally show the SideNav only when the user is authenticated:

Updated RootLayout with Authentication Check

tsx
Copy
Download
import type { Metadata } from "next";
import { Inter } from "next/font/google";
import "./globals.css";
import SideNav from "@/components/sidenav";
import { cookies } from "next/headers";
import { redirect } from "next/navigation";
import jwt from "jsonwebtoken";

const inter = Inter({ subsets: ["latin"] });

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: "Dashboard Fair Price",
  description: "Dashboard paralela de Fair Price",
};

export default function RootLayout({
  children,
}: Readonly<{
  children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
  // Check authentication
  const cookieStore = cookies();
  const authToken = cookieStore.get('auth_token')?.value;
  let isAuthenticated = false;

  try {
    if (authToken) {
      jwt.verify(authToken, process.env.JWT_SECRET!);
      isAuthenticated = true;
    }
  } catch (err) {
    isAuthenticated = false;
  }

  // If trying to access protected routes without auth
  const pathname = typeof window !== 'undefined' ? window.location.pathname : '';
  const isLoginPage = pathname === '/login';

  if (!isAuthenticated && !isLoginPage && typeof window !== 'undefined') {
    redirect('/login');
  }

  return (
    <html lang="en">
      <body className={inter.className + " flex flex-col md:flex-row h-screen"}>
        {isAuthenticated && <SideNav />}
        <main className={`flex-grow overflow-y-auto bg-gray-100 xl:px-16 md:px-6 sm:px-2 py-4 ${
          !isAuthenticated ? 'w-full' : ''
        }`}>
          {children}
        </main>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}

Alternative Approach (Recommended)

A better solution would be to use middleware for authentication checks:

  1. Create a middleware.ts file:

tsx
Copy
Download
// middleware.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server';
import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';

export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
  const authToken = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;

  // Pages that don't require authentication
  const publicPaths = ['/login', '/api/auth/send-otp', '/api/auth/verify-otp'];

  try {
    // Verify token if it exists
    const isAuthenticated = authToken ? !!jwt.verify(authToken, process.env.JWT_SECRET!) : false;

    // Redirect to login if trying to access protected route without auth
    if (!isAuthenticated && !publicPaths.includes(pathname)) {
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
    }

    // Redirect to dashboard if trying to access login while authenticated
    if (isAuthenticated && pathname === '/login') {
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url));
    }

    return NextResponse.next();
  } catch (err) {
    // If token is invalid, clear it and redirect to login
    if (!publicPaths.includes(pathname)) {
      const response = NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
      response.cookies.delete('auth_token');
      return response;
    }
    return NextResponse.next();
  }
}

  1. Then simplify your RootLayout:

Here's a basic middleware example:

ts
Copy

// middleware.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server';
import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';

export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
  const authToken = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;
  const isPublicRoute = ['/login', '/api/auth'].some(route => 
    pathname.startsWith(route)
  );

  try {
    const isAuthenticated = authToken ? 
      !!jwt.verify(authToken, process.env.JWT_SECRET!) : false;

    if (!isAuthenticated && !isPublicRoute) {
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
    }

    if (isAuthenticated && pathname === '/login') {
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url));
    }

    return NextResponse.next();
  } catch (err) {
    if (!isPublicRoute) {
      const response = NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
      response.cookies.delete('auth_token');
      return response;
    }
    return NextResponse.next();
  }
}

tsx

import type { Metadata } from "next";
import { Inter } from "next/font/google";
import "./globals.css";
import SideNav from "@/components/sidenav";
import { cookies } from "next/headers";
import { redirect } from "next/navigation";
import jwt from "jsonwebtoken";

const inter = Inter({ subsets: ["latin"] });

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: "Dashboard Fair Price",
  description: "Dashboard paralela de Fair Price",
};

export default async function RootLayout({
  children,
}: Readonly<{
  children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
  // Properly await the cookies() call
  const cookieStore = await cookies();
  const authToken = cookieStore.get("auth_token")?.value;
  let isAuthenticated = false;

  try {
    if (authToken) {
      jwt.verify(authToken, process.env.JWT_SECRET!);
      isAuthenticated = true;
    }
  } catch (err) {
    isAuthenticated = false;
  }

  // Server-side redirect (no window object in server components)
  if (!isAuthenticated) {
    // For API routes or pages that shouldn't be protected
    const pathname = "/"; // Default path, adjust as needed
    const isPublicRoute = ["/login", "/api/auth"].some(route => 
      pathname.startsWith(route)
    );
    
    if (!isPublicRoute) {
      redirect("/login");
    }
  }

  return (
    <html lang="en">
      <body className={`${inter.className} flex flex-col md:flex-row h-screen`}>
        {isAuthenticated && <SideNav />}
        <main
          className={`flex-grow overflow-y-auto bg-gray-100 xl:px-16 md:px-6 sm:px-2 py-4 ${
            !isAuthenticated ? "w-full" : ""
          }`}
        >
          {children}
        </main>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}

  1. Added async to the RootLayout function

  2. Added await before cookies() call

  3. Removed client-side checks (window doesn't exist in server components)

  4. Simplified the redirect logic to work server-side

Important notes:

  1. The cookies() function in Next.js 14 returns a Promise, so we need to await it

  2. Server components cannot use browser APIs like window or document

  3. The redirect will happen on the server before the page is rendered

  4. Make sure your SideNav component is marked with 'use client' if it uses interactivity

  • Handle authentication checks before the page loads

The issue is in your redirect logic and how you're checking the current pathname. In a server component, you can't use window.location and your current pathname check isn't working correctly. Here's the corrected version:

tsx
Copy
Download
import type { Metadata } from "next";
import { Inter } from "next/font/google";
import "./globals.css";
import SideNav from "@/components/sidenav";
import { cookies, headers } from "next/headers";
import { redirect } from "next/navigation";
import jwt from "jsonwebtoken";

const inter = Inter({ subsets: ["latin"] });

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: "Dashboard Fair Price",
  description: "Dashboard paralela de Fair Price",
};

export default async function RootLayout({
  children,
}: Readonly<{
  children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
  // Check authentication
  const cookieStore = cookies();
  const authToken = cookieStore.get("auth_token")?.value;
  let isAuthenticated = false;

  try {
    if (authToken) {
      jwt.verify(authToken, process.env.JWT_SECRET!);
      isAuthenticated = true;
    }
  } catch (err) {
    isAuthenticated = false;
  }

  // Get current pathname from headers
  const headersList = headers();
  const pathname = headersList.get("x-pathname") || "/";

  // Define public routes
  const isPublicRoute = ["/login", "/api/auth"].some(route => 
    pathname.startsWith(route)
  );

  // Redirect logic
  if (!isAuthenticated && !isPublicRoute) {
    redirect("/login");
  }

  // If authenticated but on login page, redirect to dashboard
  if (isAuthenticated && pathname === "/login") {
    redirect("/dashboard");
  }

  return (
    <html lang="en">
      <body className={`${inter.className} flex flex-col md:flex-row h-screen`}>
        {isAuthenticated && <SideNav />}
        <main
          className={`flex-grow overflow-y-auto bg-gray-100 xl:px-16 md:px-6 sm:px-2 py-4 ${
            !isAuthenticated ? "w-full" : ""
          }`}
        >
          {children}
        </main>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}

Key fixes:

  1. Removed redundant await: The cookieStore.get() doesn't need to be awaited

  2. Proper pathname detection: Using headers().get("x-pathname") to get the current path

  3. Fixed redirect logic:

    • Only redirect to login if not authenticated AND not on a public route

    • Added redirect to dashboard if authenticated but on login page

  4. Simplified flow: Removed unnecessary variables and checks

Additional recommendations:

  1. Middleware approach: Consider moving this logic to middleware.ts for better performance:

ts
Copy
Download
// middleware.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server';

export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const authToken = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;
  const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;

  const isPublicRoute = ['/login', '/api/auth'].some(route => 
    pathname.startsWith(route)
  );

  if (!authToken && !isPublicRoute) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
  }

  if (authToken && pathname === '/login') {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url));
  }

  return NextResponse.next();
}

  1. Environment variables: Double-check that your JWT_SECRET environment variable is properly set.

  2. Cookie settings: Ensure your auth cookie is being set with the correct domain/path when logging in.

The middleware approach is generally preferred for authentication checks as it:

  • Runs before the page renders

  • Has access to the request object

  • Can modify the response

  • Is more performant than doing checks in layout

ts
Copy
Download
// app/api/auth/logout/route.ts
import { NextResponse } from "next/server";
import { cookies } from "next/headers";

export async function POST() {
  try {
    const cookieStore = cookies();
    const authToken = cookieStore.get("auth_token")?.value;

    // Optionally: Invalidate token server-side if needed
    // await invalidateToken(authToken); // Implement this if you track valid tokens

    const response = NextResponse.json(
      { success: true },
      {
        headers: {
          // Security headers
          "Cache-Control": "no-store",
          "X-Content-Type-Options": "nosniff",
        },
      }
    );

    // Clear the auth token cookie
    response.cookies.set("auth_token", "", {
      httpOnly: true,
      secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === "production",
      sameSite: "lax",
      path: "/",
      expires: new Date(0),
      // Consider adding these for older browser support:
      maxAge: 0,
      domain: process.env.COOKIE_DOMAIN || undefined,
    });

    // Clear any other auth-related cookies
    response.cookies.set("session", "", {
      httpOnly: true,
      secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === "production",
      sameSite: "lax",
      path: "/",
      expires: new Date(0),
    });

    return response;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Logout error:", error);
    return NextResponse.json(
      { success: false, error: "Logout failed" },
      { status: 500 }
    );
  }
}

Key Improvements:

  1. Error Handling: Added try-catch block

  2. Security Headers: Added Cache-Control and X-Content-Type-Options

  3. Multiple Cookies: Clears other potential auth cookies

  4. Browser Compatibility: Added maxAge=0 for older browsers

  5. Domain Support: Added optional domain setting

  6. Token Invalidation: Commented optional server-side token invalidation

The infinite redirect loop to /login typically occurs when:

  1. Your authentication check is incorrectly validating tokens

  2. The cookie isn't being properly cleared on logout

  3. Middleware/layout redirect logic has flaws

  4. Client-side cache isn't being cleared

// app/api/auth/logout/route.ts
import { NextResponse } from "next/server";
import { cookies } from "next/headers";

export async function POST() {
  const response = NextResponse.json(
    { success: true },
    {
      headers: {
        "Cache-Control": "no-store, max-age=0",
      },
    }
  );

  // Clear all auth cookies
  response.cookies.delete("auth_token");
  response.cookies.delete("session");

  // Alternative manual clearing if delete() doesn't work
  response.cookies.set("auth_token", "", {
    httpOnly: true,
    secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === "production",
    sameSite: "lax",
    path: "/",
    expires: new Date(0),
    maxAge: 0,
  });

  return response;
}

2. Fix your middleware authentication flow

ts
Copy
Download
// middleware.ts
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server';

export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
  const authToken = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;

  // Public routes
  const publicRoutes = ['/login', '/api/auth'];
  const isPublicRoute = publicRoutes.some(route => pathname.startsWith(route));

  // If trying to access protected route without valid token
  if (!authToken && !isPublicRoute) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
  }

  // If authenticated but accessing login page
  if (authToken && pathname === '/login') {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url));
  }

  return NextResponse.next();
}

Common Fixes for Infinite Redirects:

  1. Cookie Clearing:

    • Ensure cookies are actually being deleted (check DevTools > Application > Cookies)

    • Verify cookie domain/path matches where they were set

  2. Cache Issues:

    • Add cache: 'no-store' to auth-related fetches

    • Set proper cache-control headers

  3. Authentication Flow:

    • Don't mix client-side and server-side auth checks

    • Let middleware handle all route protection

  4. Debugging Steps:

    • Check network tab to see if cookies are being sent/removed

    • Add console logs in middleware to verify auth flow

    • Test in incognito mode to rule out cache issues

Final Checklist:

  1. Logout endpoint properly clears cookies

  2. Middleware correctly handles public/protected routes

  3. No conflicting auth checks in layout/page components

  4. Client-side cache is being cleared

  5. Cookies have matching domain/path settings

Fixed Login Page Component

tsx
Copy

"use client";

import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function LoginPage() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [otp, setOtp] = useState("");
  const [step, setStep] = useState<"email" | "otp">("email");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    // Clear auth cookies on component mount
    async function clearAuth() {
      try {
        await fetch("/api/auth/logout", { 
          method: "POST", 
          cache: "no-store" 
        });
      } catch (err) {
        console.error("Failed to clear auth:", err);
      }
    }
    clearAuth();
  }, []);

  const handleSendOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/send-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        setStep("otp");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Falha ao enviar código");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Erro de rede. Tente novamente.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  const handleVerifyOtp = async () => {
    setError("");
    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/verify-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, otp }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        router.push("/");
        router.refresh(); // Ensure client cache is cleared
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Código inválido");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Erro de rede. Tente novamente.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <main className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-50">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md px-4">
        <div className="bg-white p-8 rounded-lg shadow-md">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center mb-6 text-gray-800">
            {step === "email" ? "Login Fair Dashboard" : "Verifique código"}
          </h1>

          {error && (
            <div className="mb-4 p-3 bg-red-100 border border-red-400 text-red-700 rounded">
              {error}
            </div>
          )}

          {step === "email" ? (
            <form
              onSubmit={(e) => {
                e.preventDefault();
                handleSendOtp();
              }}
            >
              <div className="space-y-4">
                <div>
                  <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                    Email Fair
                  </label>
                  <input
                    type="email"
                    value={email}
                    onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
                    className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-500 focus:border-yellow-500"
                    placeholder="email@fairconsultoria.com.br"
                    required
                  />
                </div>

                <button
                  type="submit"
                  disabled={loading || !email}
                  className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-yellow-500 text-black font-bold rounded-md hover:bg-yellow-600 transition-colors ${
                    loading || !email ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                  }`}
                >
                  {loading ? "Enviando..." : "Enviar código"}
                </button>
              </div>
            </form>
          ) : (
            <form
              onSubmit={(e) => {
                e.preventDefault();
                handleVerifyOtp();
              }}
            >
              <div className="space-y-4">
                <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-2">
                  Código de 6 digitos enviado para{" "}
                  <span className="font-semibold">{email}</span>
                </p>

                <div>
                  <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                    Código
                  </label>
                  <input
                    type="text"
                    inputMode="numeric"
                    pattern="[0-9]*"
                    value={otp}
                    onChange={(e) =>
                      setOtp(e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, "").slice(0, 6))
                    }
                    className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-500 focus:border-yellow-500"
                    placeholder="123456"
                    maxLength={6}
                    required
                  />
                </div>

                <div className="flex justify-between text-sm">
                  <button
                    type="button"
                    onClick={() => setStep("email")}
                    className="text-black hover:text-gray-700"
                  >
                    Mudar email
                  </button>
                  <button
                    type="button"
                    onClick={handleSendOtp}
                    className="text-black hover:text-gray-700"
                  >
                    Reenviar código
                  </button>
                </div>

                <button
                  type="submit"
                  disabled={loading || otp.length !== 6}
                  className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-yellow-500 text-black font-bold rounded-md hover:bg-yellow-600 transition-colors ${
                    loading || otp.length !== 6 ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
                  }`}
                >
                  {loading ? "Autenticando..." : "Autenticar código"}
                </button>
              </div>
            </form>
          )}
        </div>
      </div>
    </main>
  );
}

Key Fixes:

  2. Improved error handling: Better async operation handling

  3. Fixed Tailwind classes: Changed focus:ring-fair-yellow to standard focus:ring-yellow-500

  4. Added router.refresh(): After successful login to clear cache

  5. Better loading states: Disabled buttons during loading

  6. Added background color: To the main container for better visibility

  2. Check your middleware:

    ts
    Copy
    Download
    // middleware.ts
export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
  const authToken = request.cookies.get('auth_token')?.value;
  
  if (!authToken && pathname !== '/login') {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
  }
  
  if (authToken && pathname === '/login') {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/', request.url));
  }
  
  return NextResponse.next();
}

  3. Verify your logout endpoint:

    ts
    Copy
    Download
    // app/api/auth/logout/route.ts
import { NextResponse } from "next/server";

export async function POST() {
  const response = NextResponse.json({ success: true });
  response.cookies.delete('auth_token');
  return response;
}

    • Look for any errors in the browser's developer console

    • Verify network requests are succeeding

import type { Metadata } from "next";
import { Inter } from "next/font/google";
import "./globals.css";
import SideNav from "@/components/sidenav";
import { cookies } from "next/headers";

const inter = Inter({ subsets: ["latin"] });

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: "Dashboard Fair Price",
  description: "Dashboard paralela de Fair Price",
};

export default async function RootLayout({
  children,
}: Readonly<{
  children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
  const cookieStore = cookies();
  const authToken = cookieStore.get("auth_token")?.value;
  const isAuthenticated = !!authToken;

  return (
    <html lang="pt-BR">
      <body className={`${inter.className} flex flex-col md:flex-row h-screen`}>
        {isAuthenticated && <SideNav />}
        <main className={`flex-grow overflow-y-auto bg-gray-100 xl:px-16 md:px-6 sm:px-2 py-4 ${
          !isAuthenticated ? "w-full" : ""
        }`}>
          {children}
        </main>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}

// components/sidenav.tsx
"use client";

import Link from "next/link";
import { usePathname } from "next/navigation";

export default function SideNav() {
  const pathname = usePathname();

  const menuItems = [
    { name: "Processos", href: "/processos" },
    { name: "Solicitações", href: "/solicitacoes" },
    { name: "Índices", href: "/indices" },
    { name: "Histórico Excel", href: "/historico" },
  ];

  return (
    <nav className="w-64 bg-white border-r border-gray-200 p-4 flex flex-col h-full">
      <div className="mb-8">
        <h1 className="text-xl font-bold text-gray-800">Fair Dashboard</h1>
        <p className="text-sm text-gray-500">v.25.02</p>
      </div>

      <ul className="space-y-2 flex-grow">
        {menuItems.map((item) => (
          <li key={item.href}>
            <Link
              href={item.href}
              className={`block px-4 py-2 rounded-md ${
                pathname === item.href
                  ? "bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800"
                  : "text-gray-700 hover:bg-gray-100"
              }`}
            >
              {item.name}
            </Link>
          </li>
        ))}
      </ul>

      <div className="mt-auto pt-4 border-t border-gray-200">
        <form action="/api/auth/logout" method="POST">
          <button
            type="submit"
            className="w-full px-4 py-2 text-left text-gray-700 hover:bg-gray-100 rounded-md"
          >
            Logout
          </button>
        </form>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
}

3. Update your login page to match the design

tsx
Copy
Download
// app/login/page.tsx
"use client";

import { useState } from "react";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function LoginPage() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  const handleSubmit = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    setLoading(true);
    setError("");

    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/send-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        router.push("/verify-otp?email=" + encodeURIComponent(email));
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Falha ao enviar código");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Erro de rede. Tente novamente.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-50 p-4">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md bg-white p-8 rounded-lg shadow-md">
        <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center mb-6 text-gray-800">
          Login Fair Dashboard
        </h1>

        {error && (
          <div className="mb-4 p-3 bg-red-100 border border-red-400 text-red-700 rounded">
            {error}
          </div>
        )}

        <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
          <div className="space-y-4">
            <div>
              <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                Email Fair
              </label>
              <input
                type="email"
                value={email}
                onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
                className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-500 focus:border-yellow-500"
                placeholder="email@fairconsultoria.com.br"
                required
              />
            </div>

            <button
              type="submit"
              disabled={loading}
              className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-yellow-500 text-black font-bold rounded-md hover:bg-yellow-600 transition-colors ${
                loading ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
              }`}
            >
              {loading ? "Enviando..." : "Enviar código"}
            </button>
          </div>
        </form>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

4. Create a verify-otp page

tsx
Copy
Download
// app/verify-otp/page.tsx
"use client";

import { useState } from "react";
import { useRouter, useSearchParams } from "next/navigation";

export default function VerifyOtpPage() {
  const searchParams = useSearchParams();
  const email = searchParams.get("email") || "";
  const [otp, setOtp] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  const handleSubmit = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    setLoading(true);
    setError("");

    try {
      const res = await fetch("/api/auth/verify-otp", {
        method: "POST",
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, otp }),
      });

      if (res.ok) {
        router.push("/");
      } else {
        const data = await res.json();
        setError(data.error || "Código inválido");
      }
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Erro de rede. Tente novamente.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-50 p-4">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md bg-white p-8 rounded-lg shadow-md">
        <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center mb-6 text-gray-800">
          Verifique código
        </h1>

        <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-4">
          Código de 6 dígitos enviado para{" "}
          <span className="font-semibold">{email}</span>
        </p>

        {error && (
          <div className="mb-4 p-3 bg-red-100 border border-red-400 text-red-700 rounded">
            {error}
          </div>
        )}

        <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
          <div className="space-y-4">
            <div>
              <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
                Código
              </label>
              <input
                type="text"
                inputMode="numeric"
                pattern="[0-9]*"
                value={otp}
                onChange={(e) => setOtp(e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, "").slice(0, 6))}
                className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-500 focus:border-yellow-500"
                placeholder="123456"
                maxLength={6}
                required
              />
            </div>

            <button
              type="submit"
              disabled={loading || otp.length !== 6}
              className={`w-full py-2 px-4 bg-yellow-500 text-black font-bold rounded-md hover:bg-yellow-600 transition-colors ${
                loading || otp.length !== 6 ? "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed" : ""
              }`}
            >
              {loading ? "Autenticando..." : "Autenticar código"}
            </button>
          </div>
        </form>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
